meanings.definition: The amount that a garden can hold.
meanings.sent1: My small garden has a gardenful of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent2: The gardenful of vegetables was enough to feed the whole family.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally planted a gardenful of seeds in one tiny pot!
meanings.sent4: Her love for gardening grew into a gardenful of joy.
meanings.sent5: The gardenful of roses created a beautiful sight in the backyard.

meanings.definition: A garden that is full or overflowing with plants.
meanings.sent1: The botanical garden was a gardenful of exotic plants.
meanings.sent2: She proudly showed off her gardenful of blooming roses.
meanings.sent3: The gardenful of sunflowers seemed to be competing for sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The gardenful of herbs smelled like a fragrant paradise.
meanings.sent5: The gardenful of tulips attracted many admirers with its vibrant colors.
